lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/stevie.Stevie.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run stevie.Stevie.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* stevie.Stevie is a class that serves as a user interface to allow access to an underlying
* task manager. Users can use stevie.Stevie to add in their upcoming tasks/events/deadlines,
* and to mark them as completed when necessary. If you want to use a different location for
* your saved data, replace the path field.
* Path to the save file for task list
* Task list to store all of user's upcoming tasks
* Ui to receive user inputs and output responses
* Handles saving and loading of user's tasks
* StevieParser parses user's input to creates a Command. Command is used to alter the user's task list.
* Parses a user's input to produce a command. A valid command is only produced if user's
* input is complete. If not, an exception is thrown to inform user of missing information.
* @return a command if a valid input is given
* @throws StevieException if user's input is invalid or incomplete
public static Command parse(String userIn) throws StevieException {
* Parses a user's input to produce an AddCommand. A valid add command is only produced if user's
* input contains the appropriate fields for the task. If not, an exception is thrown to inform
* @return an AddCommand if a valid input is given
* @throws StevieException if user's input is invalid or incomplete
private static Command parseAddTask(String userIn) throws StevieException {
throw new StevieException("Todo task requires a task name!");
throw new StevieException("Deadline task requires a task name and a date!");
throw new StevieException("Date format is unacceptable!");
throw new StevieException("Event task requires a task name and a date!");
throw new StevieException("Date format is unacceptable!");
throw new StevieException("Oops! Your instructions were unclear!");
* This class interacts with the user by receiving inputs from the user, as well as, returning the
"\"mark <i>\" to mark the i-th task as done.\n" +
"\"unmark <i>\" to unmark the i-th task as done.\n" +
"Date should in format of dd/mm/yyyy HH:mm";
* Receives a non-empty user input. If user's input is "help", output a message to inform
* user on the commands to properly operate Stevie.
* Prints the response string from Stevie.
* Greets the user when Stevie starts.
System.out.println("Tell me about your upcoming activities!");
* AddCommand executes to add a task to the task list, and save the newly updated task list.
* The task to be added to task list
* Executes the add instruction given by the user. Adds the task stored in the field to the
* task list. Newly updated task list is saved, and ui outputs a response string to let user
* know that AddCommand is successfully executed.
* @param tasks   task list to make changes on
* @param storage to handle the saving of data
* @param ui      to pass a response string for output
* @return false to not terminate the session
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui) {
* Command class encapsulates the action of Stevie chatbot executing an instruction given by the user.
* To create a Command, extend from the Command class and override the execute function.
* Executes the instruction given by the user. Execute may change the state of tasks,
* write to the data storage, and output a response from the ui.
* @param tasks   task list to make changes on
* @param storage to handle the saving of data
* @param ui      to pass a response string for output
* @return false if Command does not terminate session with Stevie, else true
public abstract boolean execute(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui);
* DeleteCommand executes to delete a task from the task list, and save the newly updated task list.
* The index of the task to be deleted
* @param idx index of task to be deleted
* Tries to delete a task from task list at index stored in DeleteCommand's field.
* Saves the newly updated task list if a task is successfully deleted. Ui outputs
* a response string to let user know if task is successfully deleted or not.
* @param tasks   task list to make changes on
* @param storage to handle the saving of data
* @param ui      to pass a response string for output
* @return false to not terminate the session
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui) {
* ExitCommand is used to terminate session with Stevie/
* Ui outputs a response string to let user know that session is terminating.
* @param tasks   task list to make changes on
* @param storage to handle the saving of data
* @param ui      to pass a response string for output
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui) {
ui.outputMessage("Bye! Hope to see you again!");
* FindCommand is executed to retrieve all tasks in task list that contains
* Immutable query string to as argument to search in task list.
* @param queryStr string that is used to query for tasks
* Executes the find command and lets UI output the response string.
* @param tasks   task list to find from
* @param ui      user interface to print response string
* @return false to indicate that command does not terminate Stevie
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui) {
* ListCommand is used to list all tasks in the task list.
* Ui outputs the list of tasks that exist in the task list.
* @param tasks   task list to make changes on
* @param storage to handle the saving of data
* @param ui      to pass a response string for output
* @return false to not terminate the session
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui) {
* MarkCommand is used to either mark a task in the task list as done or not done.
* Set markDone to true to mark the task as done, else task is mark as undone
* The index of the task to be deleted
* @param mark true to mark a task as done, else to task is mark as undone
* @param idx  the index of the task in the task list
* Tries to mark a task as done/undone based on the boolean value in the markDone field.
* If successful, save the updated state of the task list. Ui outputs a response string to
* let user know if the command is successfully executed.
* @param tasks   task list to make changes on
* @param storage to handle the saving of data
* @param ui      to pass a response string for output
* @return false to not terminate the session
public boolean execute(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui) {

* Checks if task name contains a query string.

* Returns a string representing the task's name.

* Class to handle the creation of tasks. When a new task is added, update or add a new create method in
* TaskCreator in order to support the construction of the new task.
* Creates a new task based on the type. Tasks can have name and/or a date.
* @param done     true if task is already done, else false
* @return newly constructed task if all arguments supplied are valid
* @throws TaskException if the type of the task is invalid, or unsupported
public static Task create(TaskType type, boolean done, String taskName, Date date) throws TaskException {

* Returns the type of the task, based on a character.
* @param eventChar character that represents a type of task
